intro: Fagara discolor, commonly known as the purple soursop, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Anacardiaceae family, which includes other plants like the cashew and poison ivy. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, greenish-white flowers. Its fruit is a spiny, oval-shaped berry that turns yellow when ripe. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has some traditional medicinal uses.
